sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now. I'm Tecumbo Silako with your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The United States and Russia's top diplomats hold talks over Moscow's military build-up on its border with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We'll be asking how strong is the will of the West after Washington warns an invasion is imminent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Austria becomes the first country in Europe to make vaccines mandatory for all adults.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Austria becomes the first country in Europe to make vaccines mandatory for all adults.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And we'll take a deep dive into the submerged ancient city that's become one of the world's largest underwater museums. Tell me when they're in. U.S. President Joe Biden has once again warned Vladimir Putin that any military action taken

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: by Russia against Ukraine will not be tolerated. This clarified his position on what he described yesterday as a minor incursion. I've been absolutely clear with President Putin. He has no misunderstanding. If any, any assembled Russian units move across the Ukrainian border, that is an invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But it will be met with severe and coordinated economic response that I've discussed in detail with our allies, as well as laid out very clearly for President Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, with fresh allegations from the U.S. that Russian intelligence are plotting a government takeover within Ukraine, talks between the US and Russia are set to continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Geneva late on Thursday night, as did Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs Sergey Lavrov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Both will meet in the morning, but with each side holding steadfastly to their existing positions, it's unclear what progress can be made and how any breakthrough in negotiations is possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So with diplomacy seemingly at an impasse and tensions continuing to mount on the Ukraine border, for many Ukrainians the threat of war is a very real one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Preparations for a Russian military invasion are underway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But while Russia refused to move its troops away from the border, they continue to insist that they are not planning a military incursion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Geneva late on Thursday night,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: as did Russian Minister of Foreign Affairs Sergei Lavrov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: late on Thursday night, as did Russian Minister of Foreign Affairs Sergey Lavrov. Euronews Russia analyst Galina Polanska has more on what we can expect from their meeting later today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Extremely tough talks are expected today in Geneva, where the US Secretary of State Antony Blinken and the Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov will discuss the ukraine crisis the u.s says that russia can launch a military incursion in ukraine in the very near future and has accused russia of recruiting ukrainian officials to control the government in kiev russia is accusing the west of plotting provocations in ukraine it says that it will not take its troops away from the Ukrainian border and insists that it does not plan any attack. Russia hopes that today Antony Blinken will respond to its security demands. The Kremlin have asked for written guarantees from the US that Ukraine or other ex-Soviet states will never join NATO and that the Western Alliance will stop expanding eastwards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Moscow says that those demands are fundamental.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: NATO and the US have called them non-starters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This week in Kyiv, Mr. Blinken once again said that it is only Ukraine that can define and decide for its future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Moscow is warning to take all necessary measures if its demands are not answered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It is taking part in military drills in Belarus and today will start joint naval exercises together with Iran and China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: joint naval exercises together with Iran and China. No wonder neither side is expecting any breakthroughs today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But probably the biggest question that could be answered in Geneva is whether this crisis has any realistic chances to be resolved by diplomacy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Galina Polonskaya for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: diplomacy. Galina Polonskaya, for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Austrian parliament has voted to introduce a COVID-19 vaccine mandate for all adults from the 1st of February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Pregnant women and people who've recovered from a coronavirus infection in the past six months will be exempt, as will those who can't be vaccinated for medical reasons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Officials say the measures are necessary because vaccination rates in the country are too low.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Austria's Chancellor has also added a financial incentive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There will not only be an incentive for the communities to inform, but there will actually be a reward for how many people in the community have already been vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This will create a real monetary value for the communities, for the cities, a monetary amount that they can invest in their community.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In France, a new vaccination pass will replace the current health pass from Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The new certificate, which will no longer include negative test results, will stay in place for as long as necessary, according to the country's health minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And a second teachers' strike against Covid protocols in schools drew many fewer teachers than just one week before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Sweden, meanwhile, is relaxing quarantine rules for some key workers. A select number in sectors, including healthcare and the police, won't have to quarantine at all if they have no symptoms, despite being in contact with an infected person.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And Moscow has recorded its highest number of new infections since the COVID-19 pandemic began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The highly transmissible Omicron variant is already prevalent in the capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And across the country, cases increased five-fold in the last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: American rock star Meat Loaf has died at the age of 74.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Texas-born singer was well known for his impressive vocal performances. He began his career in the late 1960s. More than 40 million copies of his Bad Out of Hell album were sold, making it one of the best-selling albums in history. As well as his singing career, Meat Loaf acted in a few movies such as the Rocky Horror Picture Show or Fight Club.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of migrants have protested in southern Mexico, demanding the government allows them to move north to the border with the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On Thursday, they gathered outside the Migration Office in the city of Tapachula.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The migrants say they are being extorted by criminals and are vulnerable to kidnapping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Several cases of migrant kidnapping have been reported in the city and elsewhere in Mexico.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Serbia's government has cancelled all licenses for the mining giant Rio Tinto.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is in response to weeks of mass demonstrations by environmentalists who are opposed to the development of a lithium mine in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We have fulfilled all the requests of the environmental protests and put an end to Rio Tinto in the Republic of Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Everything is finished. It's over. We are not afraid of Rio Tinto. We are here for our people and our country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They can do whatever they think they should do. This is the final decision of the government of the Republic of Serbia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Despite a campaign of intimidation by authorities, demonstrators in Belgrade and other Serbian towns have blocked main roads and bridges over Breivik said it was their clear view the request for parole should not be granted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Breivik is serving Norway's maximum 21-year sentence for setting off a bomb in Oslo's government district and carrying out a shooting massacre at a summer camp for left-wing youth activists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On day one of the hearing he flashed Nazi salutes and professed white supremacist views.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: You know he's following a plan and that plan was published in 2011 in his compendium which says how he's going to use the media to get his right wing speech out and that's what he did.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And therefore I'm a bit disappointed of the media, some of the media, because I think it's okay to film the court case as a document, but not to stream it live.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Breivik's defence team argued that he should be released to prove that he is reformed and no longer a threat to society. A final decision will be issued later this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Still lots more to come on the programme. Don't go anywhere, we'll be back in a few moments.
